over the CEO title at Google to cofounder Larry Page NEW YORK( CNNMoney)-- Eric Schmidt will step down from his role as Google's CEO in April and be replaced by co-founder Larry Page. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time, Eric Schmidt said in a prepared statement. Congress. On Dec. 10, Sen. Bernie Sanders , an independent, took the floor of the Senate and didn't relinquish it for 8 1/2 hours. His words are being assembled into a book entitled The Speech: A Historic Filibuster on Corporate Greed and the Decline of Our Middle Class. The book's publisher, Nation Books, says millions followed the speech online, crashing the Senate server. Previous article Factsheet: Mitsubishi Lancer Sportback Ralliart

in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

by the prospect of Mike Pence running for governor. "I think he's the clear front-runner, and I think the race is his if he chooses to accept it," Jackie Walorski said. I think he'd clear the field. Gov. Mitch Daniels , who is considering a run for president himself, has reached his two-term limit and can not run again in 2012. Mike Pence was one of three heavyweight candidates considering the race.
